intro: Aspidosperma flaviflorum, commonly known as the yellow-flowered aspidosperma, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually alternate and ovate, while its fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds. The plant contains various alkaloids, which have been studied for potential medicinal properties.
